comment: Dr. Sumner is an amazing professor, and a great teacher to have for introductory chemistry. His emphases on participation and inclusion are unmatched, and he is very willing to go above and beyond to see his students succeed. He is not the kind of professor that just wants to get it all over with. He genuinely cares about his students' futures.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Great teacher that really helps you achieve the grade you want, if you work for it. Sometimes over-teaches topics and can give you more info than you need. Very willing to help if you struggle with topics and gives opportunities for bonus points.

summer semester. the class itself can be difficult he did an amazing job teaching the material. the exams carry weight, and he does not provide individual extra credit he does help you get the best grades on homework, Worksheets, and bonus points. Always available in office hours and responds quickly to emails. Highly recommend!
I want to be like Christopher Sumner when my brain is fully developed. A boy can dream, can't he?

Let me just say that I LOVE Dr. Sumner. He is the best prof at KSU and one of my favorite teachers I've ever had in general. He is funny, and incredibly kind and caring. I had a panic attack in the middle of an exam, and he was so sweet about it. He came and checked on me, and let me make up the rest of the exam later. 10/10 would recommend.

Dr. Sumner is one of the best professors I've had at KSU. He explains things clearly and makes tough chemistry topics easier to grasp. Exams are fair if you study, and he's super approachable if you need help. No mandatory attendance, which gave flexibility. Highly recommend him for CHEM 1212 and 1211!

I loved this professor! He greatly prepares you for his tests and gives MANY opportunities for extra credit. I struggled slightly in his Chem 1212 class but that was due to a lack of commitment on my part. He is such an amazing professor and I would take his class again in a heartbeat!

I HIGHLY recommend taking this professor!! He's very funny and tries his best to explain things to students. The course can be hard so having a great professor is not all there is to it please please study everyday if you can because it's honestly a lot of theory and math that can be forgotten by the time finals come around.

Took him for Chem 1211 & 1212. I swear he's one of the best at KSU. Super clear lectures, records & posts them, and his office hours are so clutch. Weekly homework is a little hard but nothing crazy. U can even earn up to 6 bonus points per unit exam in the 1212 class I took. Not only that, he cares so much about all students well-being.

Took 1212 Lab and it was the most enjoyable chemistry class I've ever taken. There is a lot of work with the lab reports so don't fall behind on those. Professor Sumner is very friendly, helpful and caring. Always ask for help and do not procrastinate the lab reports/lab notebook. I would 100% take him again if I could.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! Best chem professor at KSU- he is the standard for what teachers should be. He truly cares about his students. Do not pass up the opportunity to take him, even if it's an 8am. DO IT.

if you are not taking him for gen chem i do not know what you are doing. words cannot explain how good of a teacher he is, he genuinely made chem 2 seem so easy and lowkey fun because he breaks down every.single.topic down so that everyone is able to understand. ontop of that, hes super sweet and genuinely cares for us to pass. TAKE HIM NOW.
Nicest professor I've had. He made it clear he actually cared about his students and was eager to help them. He explained everything in depth and was very kind when students had questions.

Hands down the greatest professor I have ever had. He's so caring and encouraging that it makes you wanna cry lol, and you can tell that he really loves what he does and his best interest will always be his students. I went into chem feeling so helpless and not confident, but he changed that for me. Please take him if you can you won't regret it.

Dr. Sumner is an amazing professor, who I've taken whenever I can. He is extremely helpful and cares for each of his students. I have spent hours in his office during his office hours, either just talking or getting help from anything from the weekly homework to study questions. He 100% sets you up to succeed in his class and on the gen chem final.

Only a month in and I can EASILY say that Mr.Sumner is one of the best professors especially for Chemistry. He makes sure to break down difficult topics so we can understand and does a lot of explaining so we know why and not just how. He offers practice exams and if you do those and fix your mistakes you'll get an A in every exam.

I am planning on switching my major to chemistry because of his class. Sumner is a kind, funny, thoughtful professor who gives fantastic lectures. 
I cannot recommend him enough. I entered this class with a disdain for chemistry and came out absolutely loving it.

The best professor & HIGHLY recommend him for Chem 1211 or 1212. He's super passionate, has the most thorough Lectures, and has office hours where he will help you with any question you have. There's 4 exams plus the final & he has reviews that fully prepare you. The weekly homework can sometimes get a little confusing but definitely manageable.

Amazing professor! Explains material clearly and is such a nice and personable person. Sets his students up for success with the amount of opportunities for practice he provides, and by making them feel comfortable seeking extra help. Creates an environment where asking questions is encouraged. Would 100% recommend him taking him.

Would highly recommend Dr. Sumner! He is really cool & seems super passionate about chemistry and making sure his students do well in class. His lectures were great & he records them! He is accessible outside of class & responds to emails. He gives great study guides and homework that will prepare you for exams. Loved this class!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Sumner is a prime example of what a professor should and hope to be. I have always struggled with chemistry and he was a wonderful teacher with plenty of examples to work from and gives a lot of time to his students and only wants to see them succeed

Professor Sumner is Great!  I would highly recommend taking him!  He is very caring, and he wants all of his students to do well in his class.  We covered a lot of material, and the tests were very difficult for me.  He is very accessible outside of class and he wants you to attend all of his review sessions if possible.
Amazing professor!! Really cares about his students and is more than willing to help if you ask. His lectures are really clear, and he provides good anecdotes to help you remember the information.

Great professor. Tests are not too hard at all and he is very helpful if you need help. Attendance is technically graded but doesn't impact the grade much. I don't think we used the textbook at all, but you can use it to get ahead or do practice questions if needed. Gives plenty of extra credit so no reason to fail the class.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: THE BEST!!!!!! TAKE HIM. yes his lectures are long and fast, but that's not his fault. He has to get through a certain amount of material and if there's any professor you should learn from, it's him. SO caring. thoroughly responsive in email. Some of his test questions are ambiguous.. but he gives you a study guide & 50% of the test is from the HW

Chris Sumner is the best professor to take for any chemistry. I had him for the first class he ever had at ksaw and he was always helpful especially going to his office hours. I still go to see him for Chem 1152 even though he doesn't teach it he is very knowledgeable and helpful. Take his class and done be afraid to go to office hours!!

This is the best professor ever! He is so helpful and accessible outside of class. He has lots of office hours and will answer any questions you have. He keeps the lectures engaging and if you study, you will do well on exams. Every single one of the tests was fair and on material that was taught.

if you're someone who has a hard time with teachers who have long lectures with a lot of information, i would take someone else. yes his class is pretty simple but his tests are so freaking hard for no reason and he doesn't curve the tests.

I took him when there were no reviews, and he turned out to be the best professor I've ever taken- he is great at making things clear and is very helpful during office hours! Take him if you want to pass and actually learn!!! I could've gotten a better grade, but I didn't study for one of the tests. Strongly recommend him!
Awesome professor! Lectures were entertaining and informative. He worked super hard to make sure you understood what was going on. Plenty of opportunities for extra credit and to get a better grade.

Take his class! He really cares about his students. He has 4 exams and the final at the end. There is homework due weekly. He explains the material so clearly and does many practice problems in class. His office hours are SO helpful. He gives a study guide and a past exam before each test. If you know the study guides you will do good on the exam.

Amazing professor, succinctly explains things and prepares you well for the final. For study guides, he will give you past exams, which make the exams lightwork. I never opened the textbook because he taught so well. If you want to pass and understand chemistry take Professor Sumner.

Dr. Sumner is the best professor I've ever had. He cares so much about his students and wants them to succeed in the class. He provides study guides and past tests so you get plenty of things to study from. This was my second time taking this class and I went from an F to an A so if you want to get a good grade TAKE HIM!!!

Dr. Sumner is one of the best professors I have ever had. He cares so deeply about the students and you can tell he genuinely wants them to succeed. If you have the option, TAKE HIS CLASS!!! You can tell he loves chemistry and that he wants you to love it too!

Dr Sumner if probably one of the best professors I've had. He really understands the lives of his students and gives many opportunities to get the best grade. He has weekly homework due on Sundays and questions to turn in during lectures for attendance. His SI sessions really help if you struggle. I would HIGHLY recommend!

Dr. Sumner is the best of the best in terms of professors. From the very beginning, he made it clear that he wanted all of his students to succeed and would do whatever it took to get you there. He doesn't spoon feed you, still have to do your end of the bargain, but if you put in the effort, he will absolutely help you get there - also hilarious

Dr. Sumner is a super kind and helpful professor. genuinely one of the best profs I've had. as long as you're showing up to class you should absolutely be able to pass and if the class is a confusing subject for you he's more than helpful if you ask.

Dr. Sumner is an excellent chemistry professor. This is my third time taking 1211 (failed once and withdrew once). However, I am doing significantly better this time around because Dr. Sumer teaches in a way that is easier to understand. His office hours are also EXTREMELY HELPFUL - go to them if you struggle to grasp the concepts from lecture.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: he's a good teacher don't get me wrong but your grade really depends on his tests and he doesn't make them easy. They are quite hard. He says he takes questions from the homework and his PowerPoints but on test day, the most material is new.

He is magnificent, he makes a hard subject easy to comprehend. He truly cares about you understanding the material and tries to make it very digestible. He gives a 15-26ish question homework every week except test weeks and 4 tests + 1 final. His tests go over what he teaches, and he makes a lot of sense. Please take him if you can!

Sumner is by far the best chemistry professor. If you can take him, do it. Study the power points and attend SI sessions. Makes chemistry easy. Extremely nice and understanding when you talk to him. Also helpful out of class.

Easily the best professor I've had. This
was the fourth time I've taken a
chemistry class throughout the years,
but it was the first time I actually
understood it. He roots for your success
and encourages questions. There's
weekly homework, and he offers a two
day grace period in case you forget. I'm
also amazed that he learned our
names.

Dr. Sumner is by far the best teacher I've ever had. He is patient and cares about his students. Not only can he explain any concept, but he'll take the time to work through some practice problems with you during office hours. Very friendly and easy to approach, so definitely take Sumner!!

Dr. Sumner is the best professor I have had at KSU. I took CHEM 1211 and 1211L with him, and have done incredibly well in both despite not being naturally the best at chemistry. He goes above and beyond for all his students and is always very kind, respectful, and flexible. Could not recommend more.

Dr. Sumner was an amazing teacher for 1211L, he has an open personality, A strong background in chemistry, and a good sense of "dad" humor.  I never felt stuck in his class, and he was so helpful to the point of helping me with my 1211 work as well.  Great teacher, well versed, friendly, lenient where necessary, and safe with lab procedure.

I absolutely love this professor. He was very helpful during office hours and always tends to respond in less then 24 hours. Very easy to talk to and has online HW that he gives you a week to finish. Curves tests. Gives some extra credit. Overall a good guy and a easy laid back teacher. Class average tended to be around a B. Least was C+. Love him!

Professor Sumner is great. He honesty made me fall in love with chemistry. Amazing lectures, gives study guides before tests and is willing to help outside of class. GO TO CLASS! The homework is sometimes hard but you can get help. Do not slack off and you will pass with an A. Just do the work and study the materials he gives you.
Amazing professor!! Knows content well and gives good feedback. Always a chance to make extra credits throughout course. If you can, TAKE SUMNER!!!!
One of my favorite professor, had no reviews when taking the course, but turned out to be the best professor. Got 2 100s back to back on the test, really easy class if you LEARN the material.

Professor Sumner is AMAZING! He made chemistry really fun and enjoyable for every student. He cares a lot about his students and he's always willing to help you in class and after class. He's always available to answer questions and provides students with so many resources to succeed in the class. I recommend taking his class 100%

Dr. Sumner is very kind and helpful in lab. He is great at explaining hard topics and explains the machines used with great detail. There are four lab reports, but he is a fair grader and provides great feedback. I thoroughly enjoyed having him as a professor.

You gotta take Professor Sumner's lab class! This is an upper-level course, so it will be challenging. However, he gives clear feedback on what is expected and answers any questions or concerns you may have. You can tell that he wants everyone to succeed! A must take professor.
Professor Sumner is absolutely who you want to take for this lab. He's great at offering feedback, and is often available outside of class if you need help.

Dr. Sumner is one of the best professors at KSU. He is very approachable, and he wants his students to succeed and actually learn something. He's given me great advice for my professional career, too. I can't recommend you to take him enough!!

Really great guy and professor. Very knowledgeable about chemistry and tries his hardest to make sure you understand the concepts. Plenty of opportunities to receive help from him outside of class. One of the best teachers I've ever had! 4 tests and final. Final can replace all test grades with a theoretical 100. All chem class finals are the same.

Professor Sumner is probably one of the most amazing professors I have ever had. He's very helpful and works with you in a calm and caring way. There are many opportunities to replace grades and bonus points. 10/10 would recommend!!!!!!

Great Professor, I took Chem 1211 with him, amazing professor. Caring, accessible, doesn't make the class needlessly difficult and will be very willing to help when things do get difficult. If you're taking Chemistry, TAKE HIM, he's awesome.

TAKE CHRISTOPHER SUMNER.  he is so caring and he offers EVERYTHING you would think to help, and it does help. He does participation grades, he works problems out and he ALWAYS is open to help you after class and or in office hours. BEST TEACHER EVERRRRRRRRRRR!!!

very enthusiastic about the course. he answers questions and makes sure you understand the content. very funny and sweet. he cares a lot about his students and offers a ton of extra credit towards the end of the semester. my favorite professor at ksu so far! highly recommend taking him.
